[ 5 ] . BDNF transiently stabilizes silent NM synapses during the period of transition from polyneuronal to mononeuronal innervation of skeletal muscle fibers [ 6 ] . BDNF and CNTF cooperatively affect efficiency of embryonic xenopus neuromuscular synapses in culture [ 7 8 ] . BDNF stimulates transmitter release from neuromuscular synapses [ 9 ] and enhances the efficiency of transmission at the neuromuscular synapse [ 10 ] . BDNF, together with NT-3, can restore neuregulin levels and a normal distribution of AchR at the neuromuscular junction blocked with curare [ 11 ] . BDNF, in conjunction with fibronectin, increases spontaneous synaptic currents in the cultured embryonic xenopus neuromuscular junction [ 12 ] . BDNF down-regulates AchR clustering, most likely by binding to TrkB expressed in myocytes [ 13 ] . BDNF downregulates agrin levels in muscle but increases neuregulin in ventral horn spinal motor neurons at the time when they form neuromuscular synapses [ 14 ] .
All known BDNF gene 5' exons are directly spliced to the common coding exon, generating mature messages that contain two exons, a single 5' non-coding and the common coding exon.

Endothelial cells are known to express BDNF [ 37 ] , and so do Schwann cells [ 38 ] . These cells may contribute to the exon 1c transcripts.

Exon 1b was found at nucleotides 1050-1101, exon 1b' at nucleotides 2006-2200, and exon 1c at nucleotides 6100-6397 (figure 2).
The neurotrophin family includes Nerve Growth Factor (NGF), Neurotrophin-3 (NT-3), Neurotrophin-4/5 (NT-4/5), Neurotrophin-6 (NT6) and Brain-derived Neurotrophic Factor (BDNF).

BDNF production is activity dependent [ 11 15 ] Muscle activity is required to maintain BDNF mRNA levels in rat soleus muscle [ 16 17 ] . Vigorous exercise increases BDNF mRNA levels above baseline [ 17 ] . Neuromuscular blockade in culture also decreases BDNF mRNA levels.

BDNF production is activity dependent [ 11 15 ] Muscle activity is required to maintain BDNF mRNA levels in rat soleus muscle [ 16 17 ] . Vigorous exercise increases BDNF mRNA levels above baseline [ 17 ] . Neuromuscular blockade in culture also decreases BDNF mRNA levels.

All known BDNF gene 5' exons are directly spliced to the common coding exon, generating mature messages that contain two exons, a single 5' non-coding and the common coding exon.
They all consist of two exons: one of the 5' non-coding exons followed by the coding exon, which is common to all transcripts.
